title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972)
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Transport of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Transport of 

Passengers by Road) Regulations 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (transport passenger road) regulation 2021

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972)
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations:
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations: 

“authorising authority” means the person or body designated in accordance 
with Regulation 3 to be the authorising authority; 

“Authority” means the National Transport Authority; 

“competent authority” means the person or body designated under Regulation 3 
to be the competent authority; 

“EU-UK Trade and Cooperation Agreement” means 
the Trade and 
Cooperation Agreement between the European Union and the European 
Atomic Energy Community, of the one part, and the United Kingdom of Great 
Britain and Northern Ireland, of the other part1 which entered into force on 1 
May 20212 approved, on behalf of the European Union, by Council Decision 
(EU) 2021/689 of 29 April 20213. 

(2) In these Regulations a reference to a numbered Article without 
qualification is to an Article so numbered in the EU-UK Trade and 
Cooperation Agreement. 

(3) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and which is 
also used in the EU-UK Trade and Cooperation Agreement has, unless the 
contrary intention appears, the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in 
the EU-UK Trade and Cooperation Agreement.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation authorising authority mean person body designated accordance regulation 3 authorising authority authority mean national transport authority competent authority mean person body designated regulation 3 competent authority eu-uk trade cooperation agreement mean trade cooperation agreement european union european atomic energy community one part united kingdom great britain northern ireland part1 entered force 1 may 20212 approved behalf european union council decision (eu) 2021 689 29 april 20213 (2) regulation reference numbered article without qualification article numbered eu-uk trade cooperation agreement (3) word expression used regulation also used eu-uk trade cooperation agreement unless contrary intention appears meaning regulation eu-uk trade cooperation agreement

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972)
heading: 3. The Authority is designated as the competent authority for the purpose
text_raw:
3. The Authority is designated as the competent authority for the purpose 
of Articles 476(2) and (7), 477(1) to (7), 478(1) and (3), 479, 480, 481(1) and 
(3) and 483(3) of Part Two, Heading Three, Title II of the EU-UK Trade and

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th November, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [624] 3 

Cooperation Agreement and these Regulations in so far as they give full effect 
to those Articles, and accordingly, the Authority shall be the authorising 
authority, within the meaning of Article 477(1), for the purposes, as 
appropriate, of those Articles.

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972)
heading: 4. The fees set out in column (3) of the Schedule are the fees that shall be
text_raw:
4. The fees set out in column (3) of the Schedule are the fees that shall be 
charged by the Authority for each service specified in column (2) at the same 
reference number rendered by the Authority.

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give effect to the Trade and Cooperation Agreement (TCA) 
between the European Union and European Atomic Energy Community, of the 
one part, and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, of the 
other part, which entered into force on 1 May 2021 approved, on behalf of the 
European Union, by Council Decision (EU) 2021/689 of 29 April 2021, as 
regards certain provisions relating to the transport of passengers by road. 

These Regulations provide for the designation of the National Transport 
Authority (NTA) as the competent authority, and where appropriate as the 
authorising authority, for the purposes of certain aspects of the TCA which 
relate to the transport of passengers by road. Provision is also made for the 
charging of fees by the NTA in the context of their role as a competent 
authority/authorising authority under the Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [624]
